value: Academic Study of a Cast of a Classical Female Bust

label: Description
value: Study of a cast of a classical female bust, seen frontally. Her wavy hair is arranged in a style resembling a bow on top of her head. Possibly the "Venus Capitoline."

label: Physical description
value: Black and white chalk on brown paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne
Academic Study of a Male Nude

label: Description
value: Seated male nude, shown frontally, with his left leg drawn up, his right hand rested on his left knee, and his left arm behind him.

label: Physical description
value: Black and white chalk on paper with grey prepared ground

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne

label: Description
value: Head of a nun in right profile, her gaze directed upwards.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne

label: Description
value: A large tree, surrounded by bushes, is depicted on the left. The presence of other trees is suggested in the background. The top corners of the sheet are chamfered.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk on laid cream paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne

label: Description
value: The Virgin is shown seated with the Child in her lap at the extreme right, before whom the three Kings pay homage. Angels and the Star appear above. Other figures, including four kneeling, and two camels appear on the left. Framing lines are drawn in ink around the picture.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash and white gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne
Half-length Sketch of an Elderly Pilgrim

label: Description
value: Half-length, elderly bearded man, facing half left, holds a walking stick in his right hand and clutches a string of beads in his left. A sketch of what appears to be a skull appears on the upper right.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne

label: Description
value: Head of a Fury, one of the creatures in Greek mythology that was responsible for exacting divine retribution from those guilty of wrong-doing. She is seen from above, grimacing and looking down, with her head turned slightly to the left.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne

label: Description
value: Standing Cupid, walking toward the left, with his left arm pointing behind him and his head turned to the right. He holds a bow in his right hand.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne

label: Description
value: Large zigzag design consisting of four rows in shades of tan, dark blue, on red background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: Technique: discontinuous interlocked warps with continuous weft

label: Description
value: Narrow woven band with repeats of geometrical motifs in red, dark brown and yellow. Blue welts on warps of natural cotton and brown wool twisted together.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton and wool warp, wool weft Technique: slit tapestry

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Carrying cloth of loosely woven, crepe-spun, indigo-dyed cotton, with stripes of brown and natural off-white cotton.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave with warp floats, crêpe spun; four selvedges Label: crepe-spun cotton plain weave with warp floats

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Fragment with a plain blue cloth background with red geometrical motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary warp and weft patterning

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Fragment of a border with highly conventionalized birds in tan. Fringes at the bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: 1) discontinuous supplementary wefts in a plain weave foundation 2) weft-faced plain weave on grouped warps

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Paper disc with a hole in the center, 8 rectangular perforations evenly spaced along perimeter for viewing. In the outermost ring, several still images show a dancing man in oriental costume in various stages of a low squat. In the innermost ring, a sun with a face  orbits around a planet, showing the stages of day and night. Closest to the central perforation is a ring of blue stars at various angles.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Paper disc with a hole in the center, 10 rectangular perforations evenly spaced along perimeter for viewing. Arranged in a ring, several still images show the progressive distortion of a male figure's head and face.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
Phenakistiscope Disc with Cats and Donkey

label: Description
value: Paper disc with a hole in the center, 10 rectangular perforations evenly spaced along perimeter for viewing. In the outermost ring, several still images show the progress of a large cat chasing a small cat with a mouse in its teeth; the large cat jumps over a stool with a red cushion. In the innermost ring, a donkey wearing a blue shirt moves its ears.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Paper disc with a hole in the center, 10 rectangular perforations evenly spaced along perimeter for viewing. In the outermost ring, several still images show a small black circle passing forward over a red and white circle. In the innermost ring, a black and yellow circle rotate around the edges of a blue and red layered star.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again

label: Description
value: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

label: Physical description
value: Newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
